greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: row n is the expansion of (-x^2 + 2*x + 1)^n.
comment: The n-th row consists of the coefficients in the expansion of Sum_{j=0..n} A007318(n, j)*(2*x)^j*(1 - x^2)^(n - j).
reference: Gengzhe Chang and Thomas W. Sederberg, Over and Over Again, The Mathematical Association of America, 1997, p. 164, figure 26.1.
Henry McKean and Victor Moll, Elliptic Curves: Function Theory, Geometry, Arithmetic, Cambridge University Press, 1997, p. 106, figure 2.22.
formula: Row n is made of coefficients of: (-x^2 + 2*x + 1)^n. - _Thomas Baruchel_, Jan 15 2015
program: (Maxima) create_list(ratcoef((-x^2 + 2*x + 1)^n, x, k), n, 0, 10, k, 0, 2*n); /* _Franck Maminirina Ramaharo_, Oct 13 2018 */
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Oct 04 2006
ext: Edited, and offset corrected by _Franck Maminirina Ramaharo_, Oct 13 2018
